meanings.definition: A person who is easily angered or has a quick temper.
meanings.sent1: My brother is a cholers when he doesn't get his way.
meanings.sent2: The cholers in the office always starts arguments.
meanings.sent3: The cholers at the party made everyone uncomfortable with their outbursts.
meanings.sent4: Her cholers were like a storm brewing, ready to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the cholers, for their anger can be fierce and sudden.

meanings.definition: A feeling of anger or irritability.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide her cholers when her plans were ruined.
meanings.sent2: His cholers were evident in his clenched fists and furrowed brow.
meanings.sent3: The cat's cholers were clear when it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds outside matched her internal cholers perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with tension, the cholers palpable in the air.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become angry or irritated.
meanings.sent1: His constant teasing would always cholers his little sister.
meanings.sent2: The rude comments began to cholers the usually calm teacher.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to cholers him, but my joke hit a nerve.
meanings.sent4: The delay in the train schedule cholers many commuters waiting on the platform.
meanings.sent5: The miscommunication could easily cholers the entire team if not addressed promptly.
